== Moral Vocabulary and Concepts==
 
== Moral Vocabulary and Concepts==
 
 
−
Morality can be considered a key component of [[folk psychology]], the set of intuitions and assumptions which governs our understanding of the social world, and our place within it as [[responsible]] agents with intentions, desires, beliefs etc. Very young children, and people suffering from severe mental illnesses and disabilities are not normally considered to be morally responsible. These cases aside, lapses of morality are said to [[Desert (philosophy)|deserve]] [[condemnation]].
+
Morality can be considered a key component of [[folk psychology]], the set of intuitions and assumptions which governs our understanding of the social world, and our place within it as [[responsible]] agents with intentions, desires, beliefs etc. Very young children, and people suffering from severe mental illnesses and disabilities are not normally considered to be morally responsible.<ref>http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/mental-illness/</ref> These cases aside, lapses of morality are said to [[Desert (philosophy)|deserve]] [[condemnation]].
     
Within their immediate social circles, moral offenders frequently become the subject of [[gossip]] which lowers their [[reputation]]. Politicans, celebrities and other public figures who offend morally, are often condemned in the media.
 
Within their immediate social circles, moral offenders frequently become the subject of [[gossip]] which lowers their [[reputation]]. Politicans, celebrities and other public figures who offend morally, are often condemned in the media.
